Package logic.brick

Interface Brick

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBrick, GlassBrick, MetalBrick, WoodenBrick
    public interface Brick
    Interface that represents a brick object.

    All bricks should implement this interface.

    Author:
    Juan-Pablo Silva, Jos√© Astorga

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addObserver​(java.util.Observer o)
      Add an Observer
      int getScore()
      Gets the points corresponding to the destroying of a brick object.
      void hit()
      Defines that a brick has been hit.
      boolean isDestroyed()
      Gets whether the brick object is destroyed or not.
      boolean isGlassBrick()
      Method to check if a brick is a glass brick
      boolean isMetalBrick()
      Method to check if a brick is a metal brick
      boolean isWoodenBrick()
      Method to check if a brick is a wooden brick
      int remainingHits()
      Gets the remaining hits the brick has to receive before being destroyed.

    • Method Detail

      • hit

        void hit()
        Defines that a brick has been hit. Implementations should consider the events that a hit to a brick can trigger.

      • isDestroyed

        boolean isDestroyed()
        Gets whether the brick object is destroyed or not.
        Returns:
        true if the brick is destroyed, false otherwise

      • getScore

        int getScore()
        Gets the points corresponding to the destroying of a brick object.
        Returns:
        the associated points of a brick object

      • remainingHits

        int remainingHits()
        Gets the remaining hits the brick has to receive before being destroyed.
        Returns:
        the remaining hits to destroy de brick

      • addObserver

        void addObserver​(java.util.Observer o)
        Add an Observer
        Parameters:
        o - Observer
        See Also:
        Observer

      • isWoodenBrick

        boolean isWoodenBrick()
        Method to check if a brick is a wooden brick
        Returns:
        true if the brick is a WoodenBrick, false otherwise

      • isGlassBrick

        boolean isGlassBrick()
        Method to check if a brick is a glass brick
        Returns:
        true if the brick is a GlassBrick, false otherwise

      • isMetalBrick

        boolean isMetalBrick()
        Method to check if a brick is a metal brick
        Returns:
        true if the brick is a MetalBrick, false otherwise
